simulator.checkout

Class AbstractReceipt

  • java.lang.Object
    • simulator.checkout.AbstractReceipt

  • public abstract class AbstractReceipt
extends java.lang.Object
    A AbstractReceipt is a list of purchased GroceryInterface items, a sub-total for those items, a discount for the purchase, and a sale value.
    Author:
    jcollard, jddevaug

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      double getDiscount()
      Returns the discount given to a Shopper.
      java.util.List<GroceryInterface> getGroceries()
      Returns an immutable List of GroceryInterface items on this AbstractReceipt.
      abstract double getSaleValue()
      Returns the final sale value of this AbstractReceipt.
      abstract double getSubtotal()
      Returns the sub-total of this AbstractReceipt.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • getGroceries

        public final java.util.List<GroceryInterface> getGroceries()
        Returns an immutable List of GroceryInterface items on this AbstractReceipt. Any attempt to modify the list will result in an exception being thrown.
        Returns:
        an immutable List of GroceryInterface items on this AbstractReceipt.

      • getDiscount

        public final double getDiscount()
        Returns the discount given to a Shopper. This is a value in the range [0, 1] where 0 is no discount and 1 is a 100% discount.
        Returns:
        the discount given to the Shopper.

      • getSubtotal

        public abstract double getSubtotal()
        Returns the sub-total of this AbstractReceipt. That is, the sum of the price of all of the GroceryInterface items associated with it.
        Returns:
        Returns the sub-total of this AbstractReceipt.

      • getSaleValue

        public abstract double getSaleValue()
        Returns the final sale value of this AbstractReceipt. That is, the amount that a Shopper paid after any discount.
        Returns:
        the final sale value of this AbstractReceipt.
